**Necromutation** (**lichform**) is a level 8 [Transmutations](/Transmutations "Transmutations")/[Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy") spell which transforms the caster into a [lich](/Lich "Lich").

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips and Tricks](#Tips_and_Tricks)
- [3 Settings](#Settings)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Casting this spell gives you Lich Form for a spellpower-dependent duration. You'll gain the following:

**Combat**

- **Innate AC:** 6 (plus any AC from [armour](/Armour "Armour")).
- **[Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat"):** 5 base damage, with an added [drain](/Drain "Drain") brand.
- A **[spell enhancer](/Spell_enhancer "Spell enhancer")** for [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy") spells.

**Resistances**

- Standard **[undead](/Undead "Undead")** resistances:

  - [rC+](/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance").
  - Immunity to [poison](/Poison "Poison") and [miasma](/Miasma "Miasma").
  - Immunity to [negative energy](/Negative_energy "Negative energy") and [torment](/Torment "Torment").
  - Cannot be [mutated](/Mutate "Mutate"). Receive [stat drain](/Stat_drain "Stat drain") if you would be mutated.
  - Cannot be [polymorphed](/Polymorph "Polymorph").
  - Vulnerable to [holy](/Holy "Holy"), [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath"), and [Dispel Undead](/Dispel_Undead "Dispel Undead").

- [Will](/Will "Will")+

**Restrictions**

- Cannot drink [potions](/Potion "Potion").
- Cannot use spells that require you to be alive (any other form changing spell, [Borgnjor's Revivification](/Borgnjor%27s_Revivification "Borgnjor's Revivification"), [Death's Door](/Death%27s_Door "Death's Door"), [Sublimation of Blood](/Sublimation_of_Blood "Sublimation of Blood")).
- Cannot wield [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath") weapons.

Lichform does not meld any equipment.

Like all form changing spells, [mummies](/Mummies "Mummies"), [ghouls](/Ghoul "Ghoul"), and bloodless [vampires](/Vampire "Vampire") cannot use this spell.

## Strategy

Having this spell is a game-changer in late-game areas rife with effects that do not affect the undead, such as [torment](/Torment "Torment"), [negative energy](/Negative_energy "Negative energy"), and [mutations](/Mutation "Mutation"). The [Hells](/Hell "Hell"), [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium"), and the [Tomb](/Tomb "Tomb") in particular are good places to be a lich, as any place with [Malmutators](/Malmutate "Malmutate"). Unlike naturally undead species, you can also go back to the world of the living to deal with foes that use [Dispel Undead](/Dispel_Undead "Dispel Undead") or [holy](/Holy "Holy") damage.

The Necromancy boost is useful, but unfortunately the most powerful Necromancy spells ([Borgnjor's Revivification](/Borgnjor%27s_Revivification "Borgnjor's Revivification") and [Death's Door](/Death%27s_Door "Death's Door")) are unusable while undead. The other boosts like AC are too minor to justify training this spell in an ordinary 3-rune game, and it's still quite the skill cost for the extended game.

### Tips and Tricks

- Remember to recast Necromutation before it expires, as the spell will take advantage of its own Necromancy enhancer and last longer.
- Note that casting this spell while worshiping a [good god](/Good_god "Good god") will cause you to be immediately excommunicated.

## Settings

Users of this spell may want to add this to their [rcfile](/Rcfile "Rcfile"):

```
runrest_ignore_message -= transformation is almost over\.
```

This will stop autotravel if the spell is nearly over and allow you to recast it before it runs out.

## History

- Necromutation was replaced with the [Talisman of death](/Talisman_of_death "Talisman of death") in [0.31](/0.31 "0.31").
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), lichform stopped your [hunger](/Hunger "Hunger") clock.
- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), [Fedhas](/Fedhas "Fedhas") strongly disliked the use of this spell (penance).
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), the caster also received +3 [strength](/Strength "Strength") and a bonus to [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth").

Level 8
School1 Necromancy

Source(s) Necronomicon
Casting noise 6
Spell noise 0
Power Cap 200
Hated By Elyvilon
The Shining One

Flags Chaotic, Helpful
Transforms the caster into a lich — a powerful skeletal figure. The caster becomes stronger-willed, more resistant to cold and completely immune to poison, miasma, negative energy, and torment for the duration of the spell. The caster's necromancy spells are increased in power, and they gain a draining melee attack. The caster also gains some of the more dubious benefits of having an undead body, such as a vulnerability to holy damage and Dispel Undead, and an inability to consume potions.

“Don’t sing if you want to live long
They have no use for your song
You’re dead, you’re dead, you’re dead
You’re dead and outta this world

You’ll never get a second chance
Plan all your moves in advance
Stay dead, stay dead, stay dead
Stay dead and outta this world”
-Norma Tanega, “You’re Dead”. 1966

Necromutation (lichform) is a level 8 Transmutations/Necromancy spell which transforms the caster into a lich.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 Tips and Tricks
  • 3 Settings
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Casting this spell gives you Lich Form for a spellpower-dependent duration. You'll gain the following:

Combat

  • Innate AC: 6 (plus any AC from armour).
  • Unarmed Combat: 5 base damage, with an added drain brand.
  • A spell enhancer for Necromancy spells.

Resistances

  • Standard undead resistances:
    • rC+.
    • Immunity to poison and miasma.
    • Immunity to negative energy and torment.
    • Cannot be mutated. Receive stat drain if you would be mutated.
    • Cannot be polymorphed.
    • Vulnerable to holy, holy wrath, and Dispel Undead.
  • Will+

Restrictions

  • Cannot drink potions.
  • Cannot use spells that require you to be alive (any other form changing spell, Borgnjor's Revivification, Death's Door, Sublimation of Blood).
  • Cannot wield holy wrath weapons.

Lichform does not meld any equipment.

Like all form changing spells, mummies, ghouls, and bloodless vampires cannot use this spell.

Strategy

Having this spell is a game-changer in late-game areas rife with effects that do not affect the undead, such as torment, negative energy, and mutations. The Hells, Pandemonium, and the Tomb in particular are good places to be a lich, as any place with Malmutators. Unlike naturally undead species, you can also go back to the world of the living to deal with foes that use Dispel Undead or holy damage.

The Necromancy boost is useful, but unfortunately the most powerful Necromancy spells (Borgnjor's Revivification and Death's Door) are unusable while undead. The other boosts like AC are too minor to justify training this spell in an ordinary 3-rune game, and it's still quite the skill cost for the extended game.

Tips and Tricks

  • Remember to recast Necromutation before it expires, as the spell will take advantage of its own Necromancy enhancer and last longer.
  • Note that casting this spell while worshiping a good god will cause you to be immediately excommunicated.

Settings

Users of this spell may want to add this to their rcfile: 

runrest_ignore_message -= transformation is almost over\.

This will stop autotravel if the spell is nearly over and allow you to recast it before it runs out.

Humanoid Armatuar Naga Djinni Octopode Felid

History

  • Necromutation was replaced with the Talisman of death in 0.31.
  • Prior to 0.26, lichform stopped your hunger clock.
  • Prior to 0.24, Fedhas strongly disliked the use of this spell (penance).
  • Prior to 0.13, the caster also received +3 strength and a bonus to stealth.
